title: How to use LoL through a SOCKS5 proxy ?
body:
Hi all,

For the last few weeks, my ping fluctuated between 90 and 110 between ~8pm and ~11pm, while being at 25 the rest of the time.
I rent a small virtual private server (on which I host my TeamSpeak) , so I thought why not try to use it as a proxy to play LoL? The ping from my computer to my server is ~15ms and the ping from my server to Riot's server is ~8ms so I thought it could only improve the situation (I'm pinging 104.160.141.3 btw, EUW).

After browsing the net, I figured out that setting up a SOCKS5 proxy server would likely be the appropriate solution, since it can redirect both TCP and UDP traffic. After some time, I was finally able to setup my server using [brook](https://github.com/txthinking/brook). On the client (my computer), I tried the following software:

- brook itself
- ProxyCap
- Proxifier
- SocksCap64

The best I was able to do was proxying all TCP connections, but when an actual game starts all UDP connections are ignoring the proxy, leaving my ping unchanged. I've been spending all my time on that for the last two days and I'm starting to feel stuck.

Has anyone any experience on that? Or maybe a better alternative?

Additional information:
- I'm running Windows 7
- My server is running Ubuntu 16.04
- EUW

replies.body: Heya, I wouldn't be able to personally assist you with this one.  Reach out in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so our tech team can take a look and see if they can find options for you individually.  Also just as a heads up, we aren't able to assist with third party apps like VPN, but the tech folks will see what they can do for you.
Did you had any further success? I would like to play LoL using a socks too.
